author: DOUG FERGUSON
title: Presidents Cup, Capsules
text:
Lee Jin-man Presidents Cup, Capsules 
International team player Louis Oosthuizen of South Africa gestures after hitting his ball on the first tee during his singles match against United States' Patrick Reed at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015.(AP Photo/Lee Jin-man) Ahn Young-joon Presidents Cup, Capsules 
International team player Adam Scott of Australia reacts after missing a putt on the first hole during his singles match against United States' Rickie Fowlerat the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015.(AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon) Ahn Young-joon Presidents Cup, Capsules 
United States' Dustin Johnson watches his tee shot on the second hole during his singles match against International team player Danny Lee of New Zealand at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015.(AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon) Lee Jin-man Presidents Cup, Capsules 
International team player Hedeki Matsuyama of Japan reacts after missing a putt on the 13th green during his singles match against United States' J.B. Holmes at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015.(AP Photo/Lee Jin-man) Lee Jin-man Presidents Cup, Capsules 
International team player Thongchai Jaidee, left, of Thailand shakes hands with United States' Bubba Watson after they halved their singles match at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015.(AP Photo/Lee Jin-man) Lee Jin-man Presidents Cup, Capsules 
International team player Steven Bowditch, left, of Australia is congratulated by his team captain Nick Price of Zimbabwe after winning his singles match against United States' Jimmy Walker 2up at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015.(AP Photo/Lee Jin-man) Ahn Young-joon Presidents Cup, Capsules 
United States' Phil Mickelson, left, is congratulated by International team player Charl Schwartzel of South Africa after winning the 11th hole during their singles match at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015.(AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon) Lee Jin-man Presidents Cup, Capsules 
United States' Chris Kirk, right, celebrates with his caddie GW Gable after sinking a putt on the 18th green to defeat International team player Anirban Lahiri of India 1up in their singles match at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015.(AP Photo/Lee Jin-man) Lee Jin-man Presidents Cup, Capsules 
International team player Marc Leishman of Australia reacts after sinking a putt on the 18th green to defeat United States' Jordan Spieth 1up in their singles match at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015.(AP Photo/Lee Jin-man) Woohae Cho Presidents Cup, Capsules 
United States' Zach Johnson watches his tee shot on the 12th hole during his singles match against International team player Jason Day of Australia at the Presidents Cup on the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015.(AP Photo/Woohae Cho) 
INCHEON, South Korea (AP) — Capsules of the singles matches Sunday at the President Cup:
